title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
In a large skillet, cook the pancetta or bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove from heat and set aside.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, Parmesan cheese, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the bowl with the egg mixture and toss quickly to combine.
Add the reserved pasta water to the bowl in small increments to achieve a creamy sauce.
Add the cooked pancetta or bacon to the bowl and toss to combine.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve immediately, garnished with chopped fresh parsley if desired.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs
instructions: Marinate the chicken: In a large bowl, whisk together yogurt, lemon juice, garam masala, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper (if using), and salt. Add the chicken and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.

Grill the chicken: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade, letting any excess liquid drip off. Grill the chicken until cooked through, about 6-8 minutes per side. Let it rest for a few minutes before chopping into bite-sized pieces.

Make the sauce: Heat 1 tablespoon of ghee or oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are lightly browned and caramelized, about 8-10 minutes.
Add the garlic and ginger: Stir in the minced garlic and grated ginger and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
Add the spices and tomato paste: Stir in the cumin, coriander, garam masala, and tomato paste. Cook for 1-2 minutes, until the spices are fragrant.
Add the diced tomatoes and broth: Stir in the diced tomatoes and chicken broth. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
Add the heavy cream: Stir in the heavy cream and bring the mixture to a simmer. Let it cook for 2-3 minutes, until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Add the chicken: Add the chopped chicken to the saucepan and stir to coat with the sauce. Let it simmer for 2-3 minutes, until the chicken is heated through.
Season and serve: Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve over basmati rice or with naan bread.

title: Chicken Fajitas
summary: Sizzling chicken and bell peppers cooked with spices, served with warm flour tortillas.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into thin strips
Optional toppings: avocado, sour cream, salsa, shredded cheese, cilantro
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together lime juice, garlic, oregano, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken and marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator.

Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade, letting any excess liquid drip off. Cook the chicken until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm.
In the same skillet, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil. Cook the sliced onion and bell peppers until tender and lightly charred, about 5-7 minutes.
Warm the tortillas by wrapping them in a damp paper towel and microwaving for 20-30 seconds.
Assemble the fajitas by slicing the cooked chicken into thin strips and serving with the sautéed onions and bell peppers, warm tortillas, and desired toppings.

title: Grilled Salmon with Lemon and Herbs
summary: A simple and flavorful grilled salmon recipe infused with lemon, garlic, and herbs.
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, mix together olive oil, garlic, rosemary, and thyme.
Brush the mixture onto both sides of the salmon fillets.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Grill the salmon for 4-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Serve with lemon slices on top.

title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
summary: A quick and easy stir-fry recipe made with beef, broccoli, and a savory sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb beef (sirloin or flank steak), sliced
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add beef and cook until browned, about 3-4 minutes.
Add broccoli and garlic, cook until tender.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce and oyster sauce (if using).
Pour sauce over beef and broccoli, stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot over rice.

title: Vegetarian Quinoa Bowl
summary: A nutritious and filling bowl filled with quinoa, roasted vegetables, and a tangy tahini sauce.
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and cubed
1 large red bell pepper, seeded and cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potato, bell pepper, and onion with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 25-30 minutes.
Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
In a blender or food processor, combine tahini, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth.
Assemble bowls with quinoa, roasted vegetables, and tahini sauce.
Garnish with chopped parsley, if desired.
